parameters.definition: Maximum daily usage time of the heating and cooling machines
Time to make one regular glass pane in the heating machine
Time to cool one regular glass pane in the cooling machine
Time to make one tempered glass pane in the heating machine
Time to cool one tempered glass pane in the cooling machine

description: A glass factory makes two types of glass panes: a regular glass pane and a tempered glass pane. Both require time on a heating and cooling machine. Both machines are available for a maximum of \param{MaxTime} minutes per day. It takes \param{TimeRegHeat} minutes in the heating machine and \param{TimeRegCool} minutes in the cooling machine to make one regular glass pane. It takes \param{TimeTempHeat} minutes in the heating machine and \param{TimeTempCool} minutes in the cooling machine to make one tempered glass pane. The profit per pane of regular glass is \param{ProfitReg} and the profit per pane of tempered glass is \param{ProfitTemp}. How many panes of each glass type should the factory make to maximize profit? What is the maximum profit?
